message:
--Update : Issue resolved Now...turns out Gson wasn't the issue.

Any suggestions from Java geeks in here?.. Trust me I have spent a lot of time Google-ing the issue
story: Amr Yousef shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Error Parsing JSON String to JSONObject in Java
caption: stackoverflow.com
description: I have an application that stores this JSON String : String message ="{\"uid\":\"1\",\"streetName\":\"road\",\"city\":\"London\",\"speedLimit\":20}" Now I want to parse it back to a JSON Object, In

data.message: Thanks Aly..I Checked it.. It works when I fix the string itself in a variable. However I  am getting this string from an Azure bus service queue and for some reason it's malformed. When I use setLenient(true)  it cuts from the json string.. To be specific it cuts from the start until the 'd' in "Road" ... Any clues on what to do?
Nop, havent used Azure service queue before :( , but then the question about the json parsing is somewhat irrelevant because the library works fine but anyways Good luck :)
